translation.en: [man on TV] If you had your choice,
translation.ko: 선택할 수 있다면 안락한 삶을 누릴 수 있는 곳에 거주하시겠죠

translation.en: you'd live where life had something to offer.
translation.ko: 안락한 삶을 누릴 수 있는 곳에 거주하시겠죠

translation.en: If you had your choice,
you'd live where you were close to work, schools, and affordable housing.
translation.ko: 주거 비용은 합리적이면서 직장과 학교에 가까운 곳을 택하실 겁니다

translation.en: Sacramento was recently voted
one of the two best places in the country to live.
translation.ko: 미국에서 가장 살기 좋은 두 곳 중 하나로 선정됐습니다

translation.en: No surprise at all to our nearly one million residents.
translation.ko: 100만에 가까운 우리 주민에겐 전혀 놀랍지 않은 결과죠

translation.en: Now people are asking,
what's been going on with this sleeping giant,
translation.ko: 경제 수준은 세계 7위에 버금가고 두 강이 만나는 주도인 이곳

translation.en: the two-river capital of the seventh-largest economy in the world?
translation.ko: 경제 수준은 세계 7위에 버금가고 두 강이 만나는 주도인 이곳 잠자는 거인에 무슨 일이 벌어지고 있느냐고요

translation.en: [Det. John Cabrera] Around 1988 in Sacramento,
it was a time of a real good growth spurt.
translation.ko: "존 카브레라 형사 전 새크라멘토 경찰" 폭발적인 성장을 이뤘어요

translation.en: I mean, people were buying houses, and new developments were coming about,
translation.ko: 사람들이 집을 사고 새로운 개발이 이뤄졌죠

translation.en: but this neighborhood, for the most part, is still the same.
translation.ko: 하지만 이 동네는 거의 변한 게 없어요

translation.en: There's tons of homeless coming up and down the street.
That's where the homeless shelters are.
The homeless represent a serious human tragedy
translation.ko: 심각한 인간 비극을 상징하는 노숙자 문제는

translation.en: that is year-round, and the effort to help them goes on.
translation.ko: 1년 내내 끊이지 않고 도움의 손길도 계속되고 있습니다

translation.en: [reporter] A city report found that
translation.ko: 시 보고서에 따르면 도움을 요청한 노숙자

translation.en: one in five who sought help or food was turned away.
[Judy] At that time, County Mental Health
had created a homeless task force.
translation.ko: 노숙자 전담반을 만들었어요 "주디, 전 사회 복지사 볼런티어스 오브 아메리카"

translation.en: Volunteers of America was part of that task force.
Our goal was to get them off the street
translation.ko: 우리의 목표는 그들을 길에서 벗어나게 하고

translation.en: and get them connected with mental health services and a decent place to live.
translation.ko: 정신 건강국과 연계해 살기 좋은 곳을 찾아주는 거였어요

translation.en: [Judy on video] They suffer from paranoia,
and that keeps them from going to shelters,
from getting into decent living situations.
On the very first day, I noticed him.
I have it on video.
His birth name was Alvaro Gonzales Montoya.
People called him Bert.
I have a son that's mentally ill,
translation.ko: 제 아들도 정신 질환을 앓고 있는데

translation.en: and he had a lot of delusions and a lot of fears.
And I recognized that in Bert right away.
[Judy on video] The voices that talk to you, did they go away with the medicine?
translation.ko: 당신한테 말하는 그 목소리들이 약을 먹고 사라졌나요?

translation.en: -No, they didn't go away. -[Judy on video] They didn't go away.
[Judy] Bert was born in Costa Rica.
And he came with his family when he was about 16 to one of the southern states.
translation.ko: 16세 무렵 가족과 미국 남부의 한 주로 이주했어요

translation.en: He began to get schizophrenia at age 16.
[Judy on video] Do you think if you took medicine for a couple of weeks, they would go away?
translation.ko: 2주 정도 약을 먹으면 사라질 것 같아요?

translation.en: The medicine makes you too sick.
[Judy on video] The medicine makes you sick?
[Judy] His parents had tried to help him
and put him in a mental institution,
and they gave him a whole lot of shock therapy.
translation.ko: 충격 요법 치료를 여러 번 받게 했죠

translation.en: When he got out, he left home.
He didn't tell his family.
I don't know how he made his way to Sacramento.
But he did end up at detox.
He wasn't an alcoholic,
but he was the one person they liked staying there.
Right away, I said, "Why isn't he in a place for mentally ill?"
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 물었죠 '왜 정신 병원에 보내지 않았죠?'

translation.en: And they said, "No, because some of those houses aren't good,
translation.ko: 그러자 이렇게 답했어요 '개중엔 좋지 않은 곳도 있어요'

translation.en: and he might not be treated well."
[Judy on video] How is it living at detox compared to a boarding home?
translation.ko: 중독 치료 시설과 하숙집 중 어디가 나을 것 같아요?

translation.en: I think it's better in a boarding home.
[Judy on video] Better in a boarding home!
Okay.
If we could find a good boarding house for you, would you prefer to go there?
translation.ko: 우리가 좋은 하숙집을 찾아주면 거기로 갈 의향이 있어요?

translation.en: Yes.
[Judy on video] Okay, we'll try and do that.
[Judy] But there happened to be a place that was so well recommended,
translation.ko: 그런데 마침 추천을 많이 받은 곳이 있었어요

translation.en: so very well recommended by saying there's a wonderful woman there,
translation.ko: 칭찬이 자자한 곳이었죠 아주 훌륭한 여성이 운영하는데

translation.en: and she really takes really good care of her clients.
[Cabrera] Dorothea Puente was loved by her community and loved by local politicians
translation.ko: 도러시아 푸엔테는 지역 사회와 지역 정치인들의 사랑을 받았어요

translation.en: because she donated to their campaigns and things.
She would donate to local charities and give them bags of clothing.
translation.ko: 지역 자선 단체에도 의류 등 많은 걸 기부했어요

translation.en: She was taking in all these people.
She treated her neighbors well.
And every Wednesday or Thursday was burrito day.
translation.ko: 매주 수요일과 목요일은 부리토의 날로 지정해

translation.en: And so she was giving free food away to the community.
[Cabrera] When someone moved into Dorothea's house,
Dorothea lived on the top floor, and they lived down below.
These were people that some would call the shadow people of our society.
translation.ko: 우리 사회의 그림자라고 불리는 그런 사람들이었죠

translation.en: Some of the boarders that she would take in were alcoholic.
Some had mental disabilities.
They had very little to do with their relatives.
Out of their Social Security checks or what monies they had,
translation.ko: 이들은 사회 보장 연금이나 갖고 있는 돈으로

translation.en: they would pay for their rent.
Their meals were provided as part of that payment.
In some of these cases,
she became the person that could actually sign those checks
and place them in the bank, which she did.
[Judy] So we went to Dorothea Puente's house to see if it would be okay for Bert.
translation.ko: 우린 버트가 살 만한 곳인지 보러 도러시아 푸엔테의 집으로 갔죠

translation.en: She seemed so sweet.
She had a box of kittens. She had little bottles of milk that she was feeding them.
translation.ko: 새끼 고양이들이 든 상자가 있었고 그 고양이들에게 우유를 먹였죠

translation.en: And she said, "Excuse me. I've got the kitties here."
We're really impressed with that.
We're thinking, "Gee, she is nice. You know, she's got a box of kittens."
translation.ko: 우린 다들 감동했죠 '세상에, 정말 좋은 분이야 새끼 고양이들을 돌보잖아'

translation.en: When we went downstairs to look at the room,
I did meet someone that I was familiar with.
His name was John Sharp.
He said, "Well, there's a lot of pluses staying here, you know."
translation.ko: 그는 이렇게 말했어요 '여기 살면 좋은 점이 많아요'

translation.en: "Maybe it's just a room, but to have a nice place,
translation.ko: '그저 방에 불과할지 몰라도 아주 좋은 곳이고'

translation.en: have some really nice food, it works out very well for us."
translation.ko: '맛있는 음식을 주고 우리한테 아주 잘 맞아요'

translation.en: I was impressed.
I thought this does sound like a good place,
and I mentioned it to her, and she said,
translation.ko: 도러시아에게 그 얘기를 했더니 이렇게 말했어요

translation.en: "Well, you know, I'm independently wealthy."
"I just have these people here because I like helping people."
translation.ko: '전 그냥 돕는 게 좋아서 이 사람들을 받는 거예요'

translation.en: In order to live at Dorothea's, Bert was going to get Social Security checks
translation.ko: 버트가 도러시아 집에서 살려면 사회 보장 연금을 받아서

translation.en: to pay for room and board.
We didn't have any connection with his family.
So she said, "I will be his payee."
So, I went back to detox, and they said, "Well, let's let him try it."
translation.ko: 중독 치료 시설에 알렸더니 그쪽에선 진행해 보자고 했어요

translation.en: In the beginning,
Bert seemed to be thriving under Dorothea's care.
translation.ko: 도러시아의 보살핌 속에서 버트가 아주 잘 지내는 듯 보였죠

translation.en: And I was very pleased
to see him develop friendships within the house
and have his own bed, his own recliner, his own TV.
translation.ko: 자신만의 침대와 안락의자 TV도 갖게 됐죠

translation.en: It was nice that he had a decent home.
[Judy on video] Do you like living where you're living now?
Yeah, I like it.
[Judy] I did want to keep tabs on what he was doing.
translation.ko: 전 버트가 어떻게 지내는지 계속 확인하고 싶었어요

translation.en: So I did call Dorothea to check on Bert.
translation.ko: 그래서 도러시아에게 전화해 버트의 안부를 물었죠

translation.en: After a few months,
she told me that Bert wasn't here right now,
that he was in Mexico, staying with her brother.
There had been a fiesta.
I'm hearing that, and I'm thinking,
"That's not like Bert at all."
There was something very wrong with that.
She said, "He'll be back, maybe, say Friday."
When I called, "No, he isn't here. He'll be back next week."
translation.ko: 다시 전화하자 다음 주에 올 거라면서

translation.en: "Don't worry about it."
Then I said, "No, what I'm gonna do
translation.ko: 그래서 전 말했죠 '아뇨, 전 이렇게 할 겁니다'

translation.en: is on Monday, I am going to call the police,
and I am going to say there's a missing person here."
[Judy] Monday morning,
I come into my office,
and there's a phone call right away. I pick up the phone,
and it was a man who said that his name was Don Anthony,
translation.ko: 어떤 남자가 자기 이름은 돈 앤서니고

translation.en: and that Bert was now no longer at the house.
translation.ko: 버트는 이제 그 집에 없다고 했어요

translation.en: He had come home from Mexico,
and his family came and picked him up.
I didn't believe it.
Somehow I knew where I could find John Sharp, who lived there.
translation.ko: 전 거기에 살던 존 샤프에게 연락했죠

translation.en: I said, "John, what's going on with Bert?"
translation.ko: 존에게 버트는 어떻게 된 거냐고 묻자

translation.en: He said, "He's not there anymore."
And I said, um, "Did you go to Mexico?"
He said, "None of us went to Mexico. No."
translation.ko: 그러자 여기 사는 누구도 멕시코에 간 적 없다고 했어요

translation.en: And then I said,
"So tell me about where you live, like, is something wrong?"
translation.ko: '지금 존이 사는 집에 무슨 문제가 있나요?'

translation.en: He said, "Yeah, something is wrong here."
"She's been digging a lot of holes."
[Cabrera] When you first look at her, you go, "This could be my grandmother
translation.ko: 도러시아를 처음 보면 그저 평범한 우리 할머니나

translation.en: or the little old lady next door."
You cannot judge a book by its cover,
and she had one heck of a cover.
[William P. Wood] Dorothea Puente was born
Dorothea Grey in Redlands, California, in 1929.
She had a hardscrabble upbringing,
and both of her parents died relatively early when she was young.
translation.ko: 부모님은 도러시아가 어릴 때 비교적 일찍 돌아가셨죠

translation.en: Her first crimes are committed down in southern California.
translation.ko: 도러시아는 캘리포니아 남부에서 첫 범죄를 저질렀어요

translation.en: As I remember, the first recorded time when she hits the system is in 1948.
translation.ko: "윌리엄 P. 우드 전 지검 차장검사" 제가 기억하는 첫 전과 기록은 1948년이에요

translation.en: She was convicted of felony forgery of writing a fictitious check.
translation.ko: 위조 수표를 발행한 중죄로 유죄 판결을 받았죠

translation.en: In the 1950s,
Dorothea worked as a prostitute in Sacramento.
And then, after a period of years, she became a madam.
translation.ko: 그리고 몇 년 뒤엔 포주가 됐죠

translation.en: She was arrested and prosecuted for being both a prostitute and a madam
translation.ko: 매춘 및 성매매 알선 혐의로 체포, 기소됐고

translation.en: and sent to jail for a short period of time.
[Wood] In 1982, I was in the Sacramento District Attorney's office on a temporary assignment.
translation.ko: 저는 1982년에 새크라멘토 지방 검찰청에 임시 파견됐는데

translation.en: The first time that I became aware of Dorothea Puente
was a case involving a gentleman named Malcolm McKenzie.
[Wood] Mackenzie was an older man that Puente picked up at a bar.
They had two drinks together.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 함께 두 잔을 마셨죠

translation.en: He then told her that he lived nearby and took her home.
translation.ko: 매켄지는 집이 근처라고 하며 푸엔테를 집으로 데려갔어요

translation.en: When they got to his house,
he began to feel very strange, and he lay down.
translation.ko: 매켄지는 이상한 기분을 느꼈고 자리에 누웠죠

translation.en: And at that point, he could not move.
translation.ko: 바로 그때 몸을 움직일 수 없었어요

translation.en: He said he was absolutely paralyzed,
but he was able to see what Puente was doing inside of his apartment.
translation.ko: 하지만 푸엔테가 자신의 집에서 뭘 하는지는 볼 수 있었어요

translation.en: He'd been administered some kind of stupefying agent,
translation.ko: 매켄지는 몸을 마비시키는 어떤 물질에 노출됐지만

translation.en: but he was able to watch her go through his belongings, take some coins.
translation.ko: 푸엔테가 자신의 물건을 뒤지고 동전을 챙기는 건 볼 수 있었죠

translation.en: She had came over to him and actually pulled a ring off his hand
translation.ko: 푸엔테는 매켄지에게 다가와 손가락에서 반지를 뺀 뒤

translation.en: and then left.
When he reported it to the police,
translation.ko: 매켄지는 몇 시간이 지나 마비가 풀린 뒤에

translation.en: several hours later after he had regained his motion,
translation.ko: 매켄지는 몇 시간이 지나 마비가 풀린 뒤에 경찰에 신고했어요

translation.en: Puente was arrested.
During that same period of time,
Dorothea was passing herself off as a medical doctor to various elderly women
translation.ko: 의사 행세를 하며 노인 여성들에게 접근해

translation.en: and taking advantage of them.
She would sometimes carry around a medical bag
to make it look as though she was a practitioner of some sort.
She had a stethoscope in there. She had a blood pressure cuff.
translation.ko: 가방 안에는 청진기와 혈압 측정계가 있었죠

translation.en: She was not a doctor. She was not a nurse.
They were props.
She was administering some kind of stupefying drug to them
because all of the victims reported the same kind of symptoms.
And when they awoke,
jewelry, coins, checks were missing,
and Puente would be cashing the checks.
Dorothea pled guilty to five felonies,
and she was sentenced to five years in State Prison.
She went to prison in 1982.
She was written up in the local media. My name appeared in that report.
translation.ko: "약물 먹이고 절도한 여성 5년 형" 지역 언론에 그 기사가 실렸고 거기에 제 이름이 나왔어요

translation.en: And the day afterward,
I received a phone call from a man,
and he said, "We saw your name in the newspaper."
translation.ko: 그 사람은 이렇게 말했죠 '신문에서 당신 이름을 봤는데'

translation.en: "We think Dorothea poisoned our mother."
[Bill] My mom's name was Ruth Munroe.
She had been working at Temco pharmacy for like 13 years.
The last couple of years,
translation.ko: 몇 년간 어떤 남자가 계속 데이트 신청을 했어요

translation.en: there was this guy that was coming in, kept asking her out.
translation.ko: 몇 년간 어떤 남자가 계속 데이트 신청을 했어요 "빌, 루스 먼로의 아들"

translation.en: Mom and Harold started seeing each other.
He was taking her to visit different bars and steakhouses.
translation.ko: 해럴드는 어머니를 여러 바와 스테이크 전문점에 데려갔어요

translation.en: Dorothea was a part-time cook at the Flame Club,
and she knew Harold.
That's how Mom and Dorothea got to be friends.
When we first met her, she seemed like a nice person,
translation.ko: 도러시아를 처음 만났을 땐 좋은 사람 같아 보였어요

translation.en: real friendly.
And then after a while of being around,
translation.ko: 그렇게 알고 지낸 지 조금 지나자

translation.en: then that's when she started saying, "Well, call me 'Grandma.'"
Mom had a little bit of money,
and Dorothea was talking about opening a restaurant,
translation.ko: 어머니는 모아둔 돈이 조금 있었고 도러시아는 레스토랑을 차린단 얘기를 했었죠

translation.en: the little cafe at the corner bar.
So her and Mom went in on it together.
But Dorothea kept saying that it wasn't making money,
translation.ko: 하지만 도러시아는 계속해서 수익이 안 난다고 했고

translation.en: so Mom needed to put more money into it, more money into it.
translation.ko: 어머니는 더 많은 돈을 투자해야 했어요

translation.en: So Mom would put more into it.
They'd be okay for a while and then the same thing again.
translation.ko: 한동안 괜찮다가 또 같은 일이 반복됐어요

translation.en: She kept hitting her for more money, more money.
translation.ko: 그 여자는 어머니에게 계속 돈을 요구했어요

translation.en: And then Harold ended up with terminal cancer.
translation.ko: 그러다 해럴드가 말기 암 판정을 받았어요

translation.en: Mom didn't wanna live alone.
So she had us move her into Dorothea's place as a roommate.
[Bill] I would stop by there every day after work.
translation.ko: 저는 매일 퇴근하고 그 집에 들렀어요

translation.en: And everything was fine up until the last three days.
translation.ko: 마지막 사흘 전까진 아무 일 없었죠

translation.en: The last three days,
I saw Mom had a drink in her hand.
And my mom didn't drink.
Alcohol actually bothered Mom. She was allergic to alcohol.
translation.ko: 알코올 알레르기가 있어서 술을 마시면 힘들어하셨어요

translation.en: She said Dorothea had fixed her a drink to calm her nerves
translation.ko: 어머니는 도러시아가 마음을 안정시키는 걸 만들어 줬다고 했죠

translation.en: because the restaurant closed down.
She said, "It wasn't making any money, and we don't have more to put into it."
translation.ko: 장사도 안되고 더는 쏟아부을 돈도 없다고요

translation.en: And the drink, I asked, "What is it?" And she said, "Creme de menthe."
translation.ko: 제가 뭘 마시는 거냐고 물었더니 크림 데 멘테라고 하셨어요

translation.en: The next day I get there, and Dorothea is sitting at the table.
translation.ko: 다음 날 그 집에 갔더니 도러시아가 식탁에 앉아 있었어요

translation.en: I looked around. I said, "Where's Mom?"
translation.ko: 전 주변을 둘러보며 말했죠 '어머니는 어디 계세요?'

translation.en: She said, "Well, she's sleeping. She's not feeling well."
translation.ko: 그러자 자고 있다면서 어머니가 몸이 안 좋다고 했죠

translation.en: I said, "Well, I'm gonna go see her."
And she said, "No, don't go in there. Just let her rest."
translation.ko: 들어가지 말라고 했어요 그냥 쉬게 두라고요

translation.en: I said, "I'm not leaving until I see my mom."
translation.ko: 전 무조건 어머니를 보고 가겠다고 했죠

translation.en: So I sat down on the edge of the bed, put my hand on her shoulder,
translation.ko: 전 침대 끝에 앉아서 어머니 어깨에 손을 올렸어요

translation.en: and she didn't say anything. She just kind of…
translation.ko: 어머니는 아무 말씀도 안 하시고 그냥…

translation.en: Just-- She had her eyes open. And then she's-- There were tears coming down.
I said, "Mom, you'll be okay. Dorothea is taking care of you."
translation.ko: 그래서 전 도러시아가 돌봐주니까 괜찮으실 거라고 했죠

translation.en: And Dorothea had talked about being a nurse at one time.
So we felt that she knew what she was doing and that she would take care of her.
translation.ko: 그래서 우린 전문가인 도러시아가 잘 돌봐줄 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: So I'm saying, "You'll be okay. You'll be okay. I'll see you tomorrow."
translation.ko: 그래서 전 말했죠 '괜찮을 거예요, 내일 봐요'

translation.en: Gave her a kiss, and I left.
The next morning, six o'clock in the morning, was when I got the phone call from my sister
translation.ko: 다음 날 오전 6시에 제 동생한테 전화를 받았어요

translation.en: saying that my mom died.
She got a phone call from Dorothea saying, "Come and get your mom's stuff."
translation.ko: 도러시아가 동생한테 전화해서 와서 엄마 물건을 챙겨 가랬대요

translation.en: Which was an empty purse.
Mom had jewelry, she had money, and…
translation.ko: 어머니에겐 돈과 보석이 있었어요 근데 하나도 없었죠

translation.en: everything was gone.
Dorothea said, "Your mom gave me everything."
translation.ko: 도러시아는 말했어요 '너희 엄마가 다 나한테 줬어'

translation.en: And she gave back an empty purse.
Dorothea had called the coroner.
translation.ko: 도러시아는 검시관에게 전화했어요 "의도 불명 과다 복용 신고자: 친구"

translation.en: And she said that her roommate committed suicide.
When they did the autopsy,
the amount of drugs that were in my mother were all at toxic levels.
translation.ko: 어머니의 몸 안에서 치명적 수준의 약물이 검출됐어요

translation.en: She poisoned her.
And I think it was over time
translation.ko: 그 술에 약을 타서 매일 조금씩 먹인 것 같아요

translation.en: with those drinks, little by little, putting it in her system.
translation.ko: 그 술에 약을 타서 매일 조금씩 먹인 것 같아요 "그램 단위의 아세트아미노펜 코데인, 메프로바메이트 검출"

translation.en: We went to see the prosecutor, Bill Wood,
so that they could pursue a murder charge against Dorothea for my mother's death.
My first reaction was I was in absolute shock.
translation.ko: 제 첫 반응은 충격 그 자체였어요

translation.en: She drained the bank account that she and Ruth Munroe held jointly as business partners,
translation.ko: 도러시아는 사업상 만든 공동 계좌의 돈을 모두 인출하고

translation.en: and then she killed Ruth Munroe.
Unfortunately, it was my last day actually in the district attorney's office.
translation.ko: 안타깝게도 그곳 검찰청에서 근무하는 마지막 날이라

translation.en: So I turned them over to our Major Crimes Unit.
They reviewed the matter.
The crime lab in Sacramento was not set up to test for certain things in 1982.
translation.ko: 1982년엔 새크라멘토 연구소에 특정 검사 장비가 갖춰지지 않아서

translation.en: So there was no way to determine that Ruth Munroe had not, in fact,
translation.ko: 1982년엔 새크라멘토 연구소에 특정 검사 장비가 갖춰지지 않아서 루스 먼로가 자살하지 않았다는 걸 단정할 길이 없었어요

translation.en: committed suicide.
translation.ko: 루스 먼로가 자살하지 않았다는 걸 단정할 길이 없었어요

translation.en: [Bill] Mom did not commit suicide.
Dorothea murdered my mother.
[Wood] After Dorothea Puente was released from prison in 1985
for the cases that I had been prosecuting her on,
she decided she had to change the way she was doing things.
translation.ko: 도러시아는 그 후 범죄 수법을 바꿉니다

translation.en: She could not be a caregiver outside of the home.
translation.ko: 더는 집 밖에서 간병인으로 일할 수 없었거든요

translation.en: So she started taking in tenants from 1985 forward at 1426 F Street.
[interviewer] Was there a mechanism in place at that time to catch someone like Dorothea Puente?
translation.ko: 당시에 도러시아 푸엔테 같은 사람을 잡는 메커니즘이 있었나요?

translation.en: There were a lot of mechanisms.
She was prohibited, by the terms of her parole,
from having anything to do with individuals as a caregiver.
She was totally… Well, it was totally illegal.
But every so often, somebody would come by
to kind of inspect and take a look and see what was going on.
She knew all the magic words to say to these government officials
translation.ko: 도러시아는 이런 공무원이나 사회 복지사들에게 해야 할

translation.en: or people working for social services.
Remember, record-keeping in 1985 is not what it is today.
translation.ko: 1985년의 기록 관리는 지금과 다르단 걸 아셔야 해요

translation.en: She had been married four times.
At various times, her married name was Dorothea McCall, Dorothea Johanson,
translation.ko: 이름도 자주 바뀌었죠 도러시아 맥콜, 도러시아 조핸슨

translation.en: Dorothea Montalvo.
So sometimes, law enforcement agencies didn't exactly know
translation.ko: 그래서 때때로 사법 당국은 누가 어떤 전과를 갖고 있는지

translation.en: exactly what somebody had on their record. Sometimes they did, sometimes they didn't.
translation.ko: 정확히 파악하지 못했어요 알 때도 있고 모를 때도 있었죠

translation.en: So it was about two and a half years
that she was running an unlicensed care facility,
having people come in and out, providing medications to them,
taking their government checks from them,
and nobody was keeping an eye on her until 1988.
[Judy] Bert was missing. So I went to file a missing person,
translation.ko: 버트가 사라졌어요 그래서 실종 신고를 했죠

translation.en: but I really fear
that there's other things going on in that house
translation.ko: 하지만 너무 두려웠어요 그 집에서 다른 일이 벌어지고 있을까 봐요

translation.en: that John Sharp talked to me about.
[Cabrera] In 1988, I was a homicide detective,
and I also was a detective in charge of the Missing Persons Unit.
translation.ko: 1988년에 저는 강력계 형사였어요 동시에 실종 전담반도 책임지고 있었죠

translation.en: An officer went over to 1426 F Street to take a missing persons report,
translation.ko: 경관이 실종 신고를 받으러 F가 1426번지로 가서

translation.en: spoke to Dorothea, spoke to everybody,
and they all said the same thing, that Bert had left with a relative.
All of them, same story.
But one of the boarders slipped the officer a note.
translation.ko: 그런데 하숙인 한 명이 경관에게 슬쩍 쪽지를 건넸어요

translation.en: -[Cabrera on video] Your first name is? -John.
-[Cabrera] Sharp? -Mmm-hmm.
-[Cabrera] S-H-A-R-P? -Yup.
[Cabrera] John Sharp would tell us later that he didn't know exactly what happened to Bert.
translation.ko: 나중에 존 샤프는 버트가 어떻게 됐는진 모르지만

translation.en: But he knew that what Dorothea was telling them to say wasn't true.
translation.ko: 도러시아가 한 말은 사실이 아니라고 했죠

translation.en: [Cabrera] What did she tell you exactly?
[Sharp] She said, "John, I'm gonna ask you to lie for me today."
She said, "I think I'm going to jail."
She said the police are coming out,
translation.ko: 도러시아는 곧 경찰이 올 거라면서 이렇게 말했어요

translation.en: and she said, "I want you to tell them that I was gone Thursday and Friday,
and that you saw Bert on Saturday."
-Then she said-- -You hadn't seen him for two months?
translation.ko: - 그러고 나서… - 두 달간 버트를 못 봤어요?

translation.en: [Sharp] I hadn't seen him. And she said, "I'll make it well worth your while."
translation.ko: 못 봤어요, 그러고 말했죠 '내가 앞으로 잘해줄게요'

translation.en: And so, I start researching who was Dorothea Puente,
translation.ko: 그래서 도러시아 푸엔테에 관해 조사를 시작했고

translation.en: and I find out that she was on federal parole.
She was incarcerated for putting knockout drops in individuals' drinks,
taking their money and their Social Security checks.
translation.ko: 그들의 돈과 사회 보장 연금을 훔친 죄로 수감됐죠

translation.en: I started to say, "Wait a minute."
It was evident that I needed to get into her house and to talk to her,
and I needed to find out what happened to Bert.
translation.ko: 버트에게 무슨 일이 생긴 건지 알아내야 했어요

translation.en: Judy was very persistent
about us taking shovels.
Yes. I did want them to go dig.
We've gotta do something 'cause I still have a guy missing,
translation.ko: 뭐라도 해야죠 한 남자는 여전히 실종 상태고

translation.en: and I wanna know where he is.
translation.ko: 전 그 사람이 어딨는지 알고 싶으니까요

translation.en: You gotta do it.
[Cabrera] My partner and I went to Dorothea's boarding house
translation.ko: 저는 파트너와 함께 도러시아의 집으로 갔어요

translation.en: with her parole officer, Jim Wilson.
translation.ko: 도러시아의 가석방 감독관 짐 윌슨이 동행했죠

translation.en: So we went in. I asked her about Bert.
She said that she was expecting us.
She went on and told me, yeah, only thing she knows
is that Bert had left with a relative. She was gone to church then.
translation.ko: 버트가 가족과 떠났다는 것뿐이고 그때 자기는 교회에 있었다고요

translation.en: I asked her specifically
what exactly was it here at this place that she was running.
And I'll never forget this.
translation.ko: 그 순간은 절대 못 잊을 거예요

translation.en: She looked directly at her parole officer.
And she said, "Jim, I'm in violation of my parole."
And I looked at him, and I remember he had like a stunned look.
I then asked her if it would be okay
if I could search her premises, and she agreed.
translation.ko: 집을 수색해도 되겠냐고 물었더니 그렇게 하라고 했죠

translation.en: While I was scurrying around looking under the bed, in the closet for Bert,
translation.ko: 전 사방을 다 뒤졌어요 침대 밑, 버트의 옷장

translation.en: I kept finding blue pills, capsules.
And people that have sleep disorders, they take this drug.
translation.ko: 수면 장애가 있는 사람들이 먹는 약이었어요 "도러시아 푸엔테, 플루라제팜"

translation.en: Her past, using drugs to knock out her victims,
everything started to gel a little bit.
I knew that there was something really wrong here.
translation.ko: 이곳에 뭔가 큰 문제가 있다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: Before we were getting ready to leave--
And I think she felt that it was all done and said…
translation.ko: 도러시아는 다 잘 끝났다고 생각한 것 같아요 가석방 조건을 위반한 것 말고는요

translation.en: other than her facing a parole violation.
I said, "Oh, Dorothea, one more thing."
"Would you give us permission to dig in your yard?"
And she kind of looked at me and says, "Whatever for?"
And I said, "Well, the social worker."
"I just wanna be able to tell her we've searched everywhere,
translation.ko: '그분께 우리가 샅샅이 수색했다고 확실히 말하고 싶어요'

translation.en: we dug around, and we found nothing."
And with that, she just went, "Yeah. Okay, whatever. Yeah, you can."
So we took the shovels.
There were three of us. And we started digging three holes.
translation.ko: 세 사람이 각각 땅을 파기 시작했죠

translation.en: [on video] This is a small garden area. It's about 15 by about 20.
translation.ko: 여긴 작은 정원입니다 4x6m쯤 되는 것 같아요

translation.en: Goes on to the back.
There was some digging in this area, also in this area.
At one point, I started finding pieces of garbage.
translation.ko: 어느 순간 쓰레기 조각이 나오기 시작했어요

translation.en: Eggshells, paper, cigarette butts.
As I was digging, I looked up.
I saw Dorothea standing out on the balcony, on the second floor.
translation.ko: 땅을 파다 고개를 들었는데 도러시아가 2층 발코니에 서 있었어요

translation.en: And she was just staring at me.
And then I started finding pieces of cloth,
and I would pull them up, and they were kind of a light pinkish color.
I kept pulling these pieces of cloth up, so I set them in a pile…
translation.ko: 저는 천 조각을 계속 끄집어내서 옆에 쌓아놨어요

translation.en: but I was also finding, as I was digging,
translation.ko: 계속 땅을 파자 다른 것도 나왔죠

translation.en: pieces of what appeared to be leather pieces.
It basically looked like beef jerky.
And then I kept digging and digging,
and my shovel had struck something hard.
I decided to get down in the hole, brace myself,
translation.ko: 전 구덩이에 들어가서 단단히 힘을 주고 있는 힘껏 잡아당겼어요

translation.en: grab this with my hands, and yank on it.
translation.ko: 단단히 힘을 주고 있는 힘껏 잡아당겼어요

translation.en: And when it broke loose, I could see it had a ball in the end,
translation.ko: 그걸 끄집어내자 끝에 둥근 게 달려 있었죠

translation.en: and it was a femur bone. It was a human femur bone.
And then I could see that it was attached
translation.ko: "검시관" 거기엔 다른 신체의 뼈가 붙어 있었어요

translation.en: to other skeletal body parts.
translation.ko: 거기엔 다른 신체의 뼈가 붙어 있었어요

translation.en: I got out of the hole, and I knew right away.
translation.ko: 전 구덩이에서 나왔고 바로 사람들에게 외쳤죠

translation.en: I told them, "We've come up on human remains."
translation.ko: 전 구덩이에서 나왔고 바로 사람들에게 외쳤죠 '인간의 유해를 발견했다'

translation.en: [interviewer] What was the beef jerky?
It was actually human flesh that had come off of the bone.
translation.ko: 그건 뼈에서 떨어져 나온 사람의 살이었어요

translation.en: Going through the dirt, I was finding it and removing it.
translation.ko: 제가 흙을 파다 그걸 발견하고 뜯어낸 거죠

translation.en: Sacramento police dug up the backyard of a home at 1426 F Street
translation.ko: 새크라멘토 경찰은 세입자가 독살돼 매장됐다는 제보를 받고

translation.en: after receiving a tip that renters there were being poisoned and buried.
Police did indeed find some human remains and took the landlord,
translation.ko: 경찰은 실제로 사람의 유해를 발견했고 집주인 도러시아 푸엔테와 세입자들을 소환했습니다

translation.en: Dorothea Puente, along with her tenants, in for questioning.
[Cabrera on video] Okay, Dorothea.
I had to get to the bottom of this.
So I thought I'm going to have to see if I could press some of her buttons
translation.ko: 그래서 도러시아를 자극하고 반응을 지켜보기로 했죠

translation.en: to get her to tell me if, in fact, she knew about what was in the ground
translation.ko: 땅속에 묻힌 유해나 버트에게 벌어진 일에 관해

translation.en: or what really happened to Bert.
[on video] Nothing makes sense here, Dorothea. Nothing makes sense.
translation.ko: 이건 말이 안 돼요, 도러시아 전혀 말이 안 돼요

translation.en: Everything you said, you can't really substantiate.
translation.ko: 당신이 한 모든 말은 입증이 안 돼요

translation.en: Mr. McCauley tells me another thing, Mr. Sharp tells me another thing.
translation.ko: 매콜리 씨나 샤프 씨의 진술과도 다르고

translation.en: And I've got a guy that's been missing for at least two-and-a-half, three months.
She was emotionless.
She would just look straight into my eyes and answer every question.
translation.ko: 제 눈을 똑바로 보며 모든 질문에 대답했죠

translation.en: [on video] You know what I heard?
I heard, "Hey, Dorothea over at 1426 F Street
is killing people and burying them in her backyard."
How do you explain the body in the backyard?
-[Dorothea] I don't know. -Two and a half feet down.
With clothing and everything with it. How?
translation.ko: - 옷이랑 전부 다 나왔어요 - 난 몰라요

translation.en: [Dorothea] I don't know! When you find out how old it is and see that I didn't have anything to do with that…
translation.ko: 그게 얼마나 오래된 건지 알아내면 나와는 연관 없단 걸 알 거예요

translation.en: -Dorothea-- -Sir, I don't know anything about it.
I'm gonna ask you right now again, are there any other bodies…
translation.ko: 다시 물을게요 - 뒷마당에 다른 시신이 있어요? - 아뇨

translation.en: -No. -…in your backyard?
No, and I didn't even know that one was there!
translation.ko: 아뇨, 난 그게 거기 있는 줄도 몰랐어요

translation.en: But she never flinched.
She never said anything. She denied everything.
translation.ko: 어떤 말도 안 하고 모든 걸 부인했어요

translation.en: She hasn't been arrested yet,
and she has not been called a suspect yet in this case.
translation.ko: 아직 이 사건의 용의자로 지목되지도 않았습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Police will bring in an anthropologist, a crime scene expert from San Diego,
to supervise a complete dig starting tomorrow morning.
translation.ko: 범죄 현장 전문가와 함께 완전 발굴에 착수할 예정입니다

translation.en: We found the skeletal remains on the first day.
And then we, on the second day, start digging up other areas.
translation.ko: 그리고 다음 날 다른 곳들도 파기 시작했죠

translation.en: [Cabrera on video] We have Ed Smith of the Sacramento County coroner's office
and Dr. Hilger, anthropologist, in the hole, conducting the excavating.
translation.ko: 인류학자 힐저 박사가 발굴 작업을 하고 있습니다

translation.en: And that is one of the occupants, Melvin McCauley.
translation.ko: 저분은 이곳의 세입자 멜빈 매콜리 씨입니다

translation.en: [Cabrera] I heard McCauley yell,
"Mr. Cabrera, Dorothea would like to talk to you."
So I walked upstairs, and she came out round by the kitchen.
translation.ko: 그래서 위층으로 갔더니 도러시아가 주방을 돌아 나왔죠

translation.en: She says, "Am I under arrest?"
"Because all this is making me nervous,
and I'd like to go get a cup of coffee over at my nephew's."
I said, "Where is that?"
She goes, "Over at the hotel, around the corner."
translation.ko: 어디냐고 물었더니 모퉁이에 있는 호텔이랬죠 "클라리온 호텔"

translation.en: We didn't have anything to arrest her on.
I had no probable cause or evidence to indicate she had killed anybody.
translation.ko: 그녀가 누군가를 죽였다는 타당한 이유나 증거가 없었거든요

translation.en: Bert had only been missing for three months.
This wasn't Bert.
So I told her, I said, "Yeah, no problem."
She came out, and she was wearing a red coat.
She had just a little purse.
So after I saw her go into the back of the hotel,

[Cabrera] By Dorothea killing these people, she gained $100,000 in total,
translation.ko: 도러시아는 이 사람들을 죽여서 총 10만 달러를 갈취했습니다

translation.en: and she was putting it to use,
donating money to the politicians, free food.
And so she was always looked at as a philanthropist who gave a lot,
translation.ko: 그래서 그녀는 늘 많은 걸 베푸는 자선가로 여겨졌고

translation.en: and from that, she gained status in the community.
translation.ko: 그로 인해 지역 사회에서 지위를 얻었어요

translation.en: That was the power.
She was able to operate with nobody ever questioning her,
translation.ko: 덕분에 누구의 의심도 사지 않고 이런 일을 할 수 있었어요

translation.en: but the clothing that she was giving to charities,
translation.ko: 하지만 그녀가 자선 단체에 기부한 옷은

translation.en: that was the clothing that was from her victims.
[Wood] The people Dorothea murdered were Leona Carpenter,
Dorothy Miller,
Benjamin Fink,
James Gallop,
Vera Faye Martin,
Betty Palmer,
Everson Gillmouth,
Bert Montoya,
and Ruth Munroe.
They were real people.
Every single one of them.
[sniffles] I'm sorry.
I didn't think that would happen.
A Sacramento landlady,
convicted of killing three of her tenants in the 1980s, has died in prison.
translation.ko: 1980년대에 세입자 3명을 죽인 새크라멘토의 집주인이 교도소에서 사망했습니다

translation.en: Prosecutors say Dorothea Puente
stole the Social Security checks of her elderly tenants,
translation.ko: 고령 세입자들의 사회 보장 연금을 가로채고

translation.en: killed them, and then buried their bodies in her backyard. Puente was 82.
translation.ko: 그들을 죽인 후 집 뒷마당에 묻었습니다 푸엔테는 82세였습니다

translation.en: [Bill] There is no closure to it.
I mean, you have to move on.
You still live,
but when there's no conviction,
there is no closure.
[Cabrera] After I arrested Dorothea in Los Angeles,
when I picked her up on the tarmac,
the last thing she said was, "Mr. Cabrera, I'm sorry."
translation.ko: 마지막으로 이 말을 했어요 '카브레라 씨, 죄송해요'

translation.en: I've always believed that in that small moment
translation.ko: 전 항상 믿어 왔어요 그 아주 짧은 순간에

translation.en: that she was actually sorry for everything,
just in that moment.
Usually, the house that was used in these crimes, they're generally razed.
translation.ko: 보통 이런 범죄에 사용된 집은 철거되기 마련이죠

translation.en: They get rid of them and put a park in there or something like that.
translation.ko: 집을 허물고 공원 같은 걸 짓죠

translation.en: But in this case, this is a historical home built in 1890,
and you cannot take these houses down.
It's gonna be here forever.
What area would you like to live in, in a boarding home?
-What area? -Uh-huh.
Yeah, do you like the downtown area, or do you like to be out in the country?
translation.ko: 도심 지역이 좋아요? 아니면 시골이 좋아요?

translation.en: -Do you like this area around here? -Yeah.
[Judy] We connected with Bert's family members.
We told them that he had passed and how sad it was
translation.ko: 버트가 세상을 떠났고 너무 슬픈 일이라고 말했죠

translation.en: and that we were going to have a memorial.
And we would be happy to pay their way
to come out and be there for his funeral service.
At the gravesite, I did the eulogy.
And all the people who knew and loved Bert were there.
translation.ko: 버트를 알고 사랑한 모든 이가 함께했죠

translation.en: It was a very sad ceremony, but…
I just feel that it was his destiny
to expose Dorothea Puente.
I just feel that way.
